result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Folk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery AMENDED FROM Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm

Defendant Nicholas J Folk in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Nicholas J Folk in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 

15CF215
Count 1- 6 Months RCJ CFTS

15CF1405
Count 1- 4 Years WPS, 1 Year init, 3 Years es, i/s, 3 Years Probation, to run consecutive to 15CF215

Conditions:
Court costs are waived in 15CF215 & 15CF1405
6 Months RCJ - STAYED 
No drugs, no alcohol
Engage in therapy, cognitive thinking & parenting class or a combination of both
Comply with family court order
Obtain & maintain full time employment
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge in 15CF1405
FAW
VOTE
Eligible for CIP & ERP
